info.description:
[Home](../../) | [Getting started](../getting-started.html) | [Postman](../postman.html) | [Swagger](#/) 
 #### Tax Agile provides the powerful VAT Calc determination engine and VAT Auditor tool over a RESTful API. 
You need an Account ID and API Key pair for the `POST /v1/auth` endpoint which will then return a time-limited Bearer token in the response. Us this Bearer token in the Authorization header of requests. 

 Please [contact us](https://www.vatcalc.com/contact/) if you would like a demo and access. 

  ##### Find out more about our products on our website [vatcalc.com](https://www.vatcalc.com/)
info.title: Tax Agile API Specification

get.summary: Status of a long-running operation. [ready to publish]
get.description:
## Returns details of a long-running operation. 

 Use this endpoint to poll for completion of an operation. When the operation completes this endpoint returns a new location header and href in body of the new resource on a `302 See Other` status.

Location.description: Refers to this endpoint when incomplete status

example.message: Operation Id is a mandatory path parameter

post.description:
## Submit transaction data to VAT Auditor 
 Send it as either body JSON, or as an Excel xlsx as multipart form-data, which has been mapped to our data model.

This endpoint returns with an operation token to use with the `GET /operations/{id}` endpoint to poll for the Audit completion.

requestBody.description:
The request can be sent as an `application/json` body, or a `multipart/form-data`. 

 ### application/json 

 An array of data [ vatDataModelSchema ] transactions, plus an options object which specifies how the system handles the Audit.  When sending Tax Agile data model format JSON, the mappingId should be set to 'default'.

 ### multipart/form-data 

 Has two fields one called 'file' which takes an excel sheet xlsx file; the second called 'options' which takes a json {} with the Audit options. 

 #### Note: Maximum file size 5mb

202.description: Accepted request and an operation ID issued.

Location.description: Path to find the polling operation

400.description:
Bad request 

 VA001 - Invalid content-type in request header 

 VA002 - Request options - missing options.mappingId 

 VA003 - Data mapping record not found - check options.mappingId 

 VA005 - File not uploaded to cloud storage 

 VA006 - Unhandled error 

 VA007 - Request body in an unexpected format. Check content-type is set correctly 

 IO001 - File not found or not of a supported type

get.description:
# Beta v0 endpoint - response body may change.

 Provided in v1.1.0 for further feedback, may be used for evaluation purposes.

 In particular we expect to add paging of results if the most recent 100 isn't sufficient.

## List of 100 most recent audits. 
 If there a no items in the list this will return an empty array, on a 200 OK.

# Beta v0 endpoint - response body may change.

 Provided in v1.1.0 for further feedback, may be used for evaluation purposes.

 In particular the ?detail=true response is likely to change as it returns a lot of data when the Audit contains a large number of transactions.

## Details of a specific audit. 
 The `{id}` for the path parameter is provided by the `GET /operations/{id}` response as the `href` field in the body and also the `location` header. 

 It is also avaialable from the summary list of audits `GET /auditor/vat/audits` endpoint. 

 The response body is a summary of the audit including metrics, datasource information, missing data and transactions.

parameters.name: detail
parameters.description:
Optional parameter to fetch a detailed representation of the Audit; if not used it defaults to a summary. 

Set to true adds the determination results from the engine for each transaction in the path: transactions[].analysisResult

 See the schema 'VAT Determination response' for the format of the analysisResult object.

example.message: Audit Id is a mandatory path parameter

delete.summary: Removes audit results and data from the platform.

204.description: Delete request accepted with no content

example.message: Audit Id is a mandatory path parameter

expiresIn.description: The time in seconds before the token is expired and can no longer be used

accessToken.description: Use this token on subsequent API requests in the authorization header with the format 'Bearer <token>'

example.message: JSON schema validation failed: must NOT have fewer than 1 characters in: accountId

post.summary: Authenticate with API Key to receive a Bearer token
post.description: Use API key and accountId to authenticate, and receive a time-based Bearer token which is then used on subsequent requests in the Authorization header.

post.summary: Send a transaction and receive a VAT determination.
post.description: Send a transaction to the determination engine for VAT. The request body supports a large number of conditions which may be true on your transaction, but all are not required. It can be helpful to use VAT Advisor to enter a sample transaction to understand the request body you need to send. The transaction can be stored if you include the query parameter commit=true if stored, the response will provide a uuid.

requestBody.description: The payload body requires a JSON object which represents the transaction. If fields are missing, the API will return a response object with context enriched guidance on how to correct the request. Then the caller can resend an updated transaction

parameters.name: commit
parameters.description: Optional, defaults to false; if true the transaction is stored and a unique id is provided in the response.

400.description:
Bad request 

 VD001 - Request body data malformed 

 VD002 - Unhandled content-type 

 VD003 - Missing field in data

example.message: Missing field: date.docDate | Hint: What is the date of the document?

get.summary: Fetch a collection of transactions with filter params
get.description: Returns a paginated dataset of the committed (saved) transactions stored on the platform. Takes filter criteria as query parameters and sets defaults to ensure a huge dataset is not fetched.  Can be used to collect data periodically to store in your analysis data store; or to build an interactive dashboard in your application.

parameters.name: entryDateTimeFrom
parameters.description: Datetime stamp in UTC ISO string format from which to select transactions to return. Optional, if not provided it defaults to current date time -30 days.

parameters.name: entryDateTimeTo
parameters.description: Datetime stamp in UTC ISO string format of the end of the date time range. Optional, no default if not provided.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number of the result set you want to fetch. Optional, defaults to 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of transactions to return in a page of results. Optional, defaults to 20.

parameters.name: docNumber
parameters.description: Filter result set by matching a document number provided on the original request.

parameters.name: vatCode
parameters.description: Filter result set by matching a VAT code from the VAT determination made by our engine.

entryDateTime.description: Datetime the transaction was created on our platform

_id.description: Unique id issued by our platform for this transaction

get.summary: Return a specific transaction by id
get.description:
Providing the id of the transaction will fetch the transaction from the Tax Agile platform; by default it returns a summary of the payload sent in, and our response back. 

 Using the `?detail=true` query parameter returns a detail representation of the transaction and how it was processed by our engine.

parameters.name: detail
parameters.description: Optional parameter to fetch a detailed representation of the transaction; if not used it defaults to a summary
